lead_paragraph: Comcast suffered a setback as it canceled its offer for Time Warner Cable, but the executive at the company’s helm will likely continue in his father’s footsteps as a daring deal maker.

headline.print_headline: Comcast Withdraws Purchase Bid, but It Isn’t Going Anywhere
headline.main: Comcast Withdraws Purchase Bid, but It Isn’t Going Anywhere

snippet: Comcast suffered a setback as it canceled its offer for Time Warner Cable, but the executive at the company’s helm will likely continue in his father’s footsteps as a daring deal maker.
abstract: Comcast's withdrawal of takeover bid of Time Warner Cable is example of how Comcast chief executive Brian Roberts has sometimes overplayed his hand and allowed his ambitions to get better of him, despite landmark deals like acquisition of NBCUniversal; many trace Roberts's grand ambitions to his desire to emulate his father, who turned company into giant in industry through daring deal making.
